meanings.definition: The act of transmitting heat or electricity through a medium.
meanings.sent1: In science class, we learned about conduction when we touched a metal spoon that was in hot soup.
meanings.sent2: The conduction of electricity through wires powers our homes and lights.
meanings.sent3: The conduction of heat from the sun to the Earth is like a warm hug from a giant star.
meanings.sent4: The conduction of electricity in the city is like a network of invisible rivers flowing with power.
meanings.sent5: I will never forget the conduction of heat when I accidentally touched a hot stove.

meanings.definition: The process of conveying or carrying something from one place to another.
meanings.sent1: The conduction of water through pipes brings fresh water to our homes.
meanings.sent2: The conduction of information through the internet allows us to connect with people worldwide.
meanings.sent3: The conduction of groceries from the store to our house is like a mini parade of food.
meanings.sent4: The conduction of emotions from one person to another can be felt even without words.
meanings.sent5: The conduction of sound through the air makes music reach our ears and hearts.
